p:
Vanilloids are a class of natural and synthetic compounds that are characterised by the presence of a vanillyl (4-hydroxy 3-methoxybenzyl) group or a functionally equivalent group. Vanilloid Receptor (VR-1), whose function is modulated by such compounds, has been widely studied and is extensively reviewed by
Szallasi and Blumberg (The American Society for Pharmacology and Experimental Therapeutics, 1999, Vol. 51, No. 2 .).
